tool.name: Impute Missing Data

param.name: p
param.label: Comma-separated list of sample ids of the parents of the breeding population
param.help: should only be used for bi-parental or multi-parental breeding populations

param.name: k
param.label: Maximum number of groups in which local haplotypes will be clustered
param.help: This helps to take into account cases of populations in which some of the parents are missing

param.name: c
param.label: Average number of centiMorgans per Kbp on euchromatic regions of the genome
param.help: Typical values are: 0.001 for humans, 0.004 for rice and 0.35 for yeast populations

param.name: t
param.label: Update transition probabilities in HMM during Baum-Welch training
param.help: Recommended, unless the 'Average numer of centiMorgans' option allows a reasonable initial estimation

tool.help:
**What it does**
Allows imputation of missing genotypes from unphased multilocus SNP genotype data in a VCF.
The current version is a reimplementation of the Hidden Markov Model (HMM) implemented in the package fastPHASE_.
.. _fastPHASE: http://stephenslab.uchicago.edu/software.html#fastphase
Scheet, P and Stephens, M (2006). A fast and flexible statistical model for large-scale population genotype data: applications to inferring missing genotypes and haplotypic phase. Am J Hum Genet.
-----
**Output format**
Two files are generated.
1. A VCF file including the imputed genotypes for the datapoints having an undecided genotype call in the input file. 2. A tab-delimited file giving each SNP and each sample the index of the parent that most likely originated the observed haplotype of the individual.
.. class:: warningmark
*Only biallelic SNPs* are imputed and included in the output VCF.
.. class:: warningmark
Current implementation treats the input genotypes in the VCF as *haploid* data
- it is only able to impute genotypes in populations of samples with **low heterozygosity** (autogamous or double-haploids). - it does not produce heterozygous imputed genotypes.
-----
Future versions will include more general cases and improve the imputation accuracy.
.. class:: infomark
For details about this tool, please visit https://sourceforge.net/projects/ngsep/
